bug.title: sql parse exception
bug.body: It happens sometimes when I switches active editors over different database connections. ### sql contents ``` sql desc service_schedule; select * from service_schedule; show processlist; ``` ### log for one by one execution > 11:14:47, 602 ERROR - RequestQuery:praseSQL sql parse exception. [ desc service_schedule ] > 11:14:52, 750 ERROR - BasicTDBSQLParser:parseDML sql parse exception. [ show processlist ] > There is no log for second sentence, 'select \* from service_schedule;' ### log for all execution > 11:20:03, 863 ERROR - BasicTDBSQLParser:parseDML sql parse exception. [ desc service_schedule; > select \* from service_schedule; > show processlist ] > 11:20:03, 866 ERROR - RequestQuery:praseSQL sql parse exception. [ desc service_schedule; > select \* from service_schedule; > show processlist ]

bug.title: Oracle 11g PK í‘œì‹œ ì˜¤ë¥˜
bug.body: SQLì— ì˜¤ë¥˜ê°€ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ì´ í•´ë³´ë‹ˆ ì˜ ë˜ë”êµ°ìš”. ì°¸ê³ í•˜ì„¸ìš”. SELECT C.COLUMN_NAME AS "FIELD", C.DATA_TYPE || CASE WHEN C.DATA_TYPE = 'NUMBER' AND C.DATA_PRECISION > 0 AND C.DATA_SCALE > 0 THEN '('||C.DATA_PRECISION || ',' || C.DATA_SCALE||')' WHEN C.DATA_TYPE = 'NUMBER' AND C.DATA_PRECISION > 0 THEN '('||C.DATA_PRECISION ||')' WHEN C.DATA_TYPE = 'DATE' THEN '' ELSE '(' || TO_CHAR(C.DATA_LENGTH) || ')' END AS "TYPE", CASE WHEN C.NULLABLE = 'Y' THEN 'YES' ELSE 'NO' END AS "NULL", CASE P.CONSTRAINT_TYPE WHEN 'P' THEN 'PK' WHEN 'R' THEN 'FK' ELSE '' END AS "KEY", C.DATA_DEFAULT AS "DEFAULT", '' AS EXTRA, S.COMMENTS AS "COMMENT" FROM USER_TAB_COLUMNS C LEFT JOIN USER_IND_COLUMNS D ON C.TABLE_NAME = D.TABLE_NAME AND C.COLUMN_NAME = D.COLUMN_NAME LEFT JOIN USER_CONSTRAINTS P ON D.TABLE_NAME = P.TABLE_NAME AND D.INDEX_NAME = P.INDEX_NAME LEFT JOIN USER_COL_COMMENTS S ON S.TABLE_NAME = C.TABLE_NAME AND S.COLUMN_NAME = C.COLUMN_NAME WHERE C.TABLE_NAME = ? ORDER BY C.COLUMN_ID ;

bug.title: "Ctrl+Space" Content Assist doesn't work on Mac OS X
bug.body: I tried to press Ctrl+Space many times but Tadpole for Mac doesn't display any context menu popup with SQL templates.

bug.title: "SQL to Application" should not use clipboard
bug.body: 1. Enter the following SQL into the Editor. ``` SQL CREATE TABLE sample_table(id INT(11), name CHAR(60) DEFAULT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (id) ); ``` 1. Click on **SQL to Application**. ``` Java StringBuffer sqlBuff = new StringBuffer(); sqlBuff.append("CREATE TABLE sample_table(id INT(11), name CHAR(60) DEFAULT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (id) );"); ``` This is correct. Now simply copy this code (Ctrl+C/Cmd+C) and then choose **PHP**. PHP code will use the new clipboard value which is Java code actually. ``` PHP $sqlBuff = "StringBuffer sqlBuff = new StringBuffer()"; $sqlBuff1 .= "sqlBuff.append("CREATE TABLE sample_table(id INT(11), name CHAR(60) DEFAULT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (id) )"; $sqlBuff2 = "")"; ```

bug.title: Strip whitespaces of a query in "SQL to Application"
bug.body: Tadpole has this really nice **SQL to Application** feature. But it can be improved more. 1. Insert the following `CREATE TABLE` SQL to the Editor. ``` SQL CREATE TABLE sample_table ( id INT(11), name char(60) default NULL, PRIMARY KEY (id) ); ``` 1. Click on **Format SQL**. This will make the SQL look beautiful. ``` SQL CREATE TABLE sample_table(id INT(11), name CHAR(60) DEFAULT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (id) ); ``` 1. Click on **SQL to Application**. A modal window will pop up with Java or PHP code. ``` Java StringBuffer sqlBuff = new StringBuffer(); sqlBuff.append("CREATE TABLE sample_table(id INT(11), name CHAR(60) DEFAULT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (id) );"); ``` As you can see the SQL in the above code has very long whitespaces which were added after **Format SQL** step. When converting **SQL to Application** it would be good to strip these whitespaces off.

bug.title: Tadpole inserts WHERE into SQL which leads to Syntax error
bug.body: CUBRID has a **demodb** database. 1. Connect to demodb database. 2. Simply run the following SQL `select * from stadium limit 10`. This will display "**Syntax: syntax error, unexpected WHERE**". Expected successful execution of the query.

bug.title: Zoom Percentage freeze, doesn't auto update [Video included]
bug.body: Bug in Chrome 20 on Mac OS X. Safari on Mac works ok. See this screen video http://ge.tt/api/1/files/5AYCVYK/0/blob?download. Steps to reproduce: 1. Select a DB Connection 2. Click on "ER View" in the toolbar. A new ER tab should be opened. 3. Now in the toolbar *_Zoom_ related tools should be enabled such as: Zoom In, Zoom Out, and Dropdown box to select specific percentage. Click on dropdown arrow and start clicking on UP/DOWN arrows of the scrollbar. The % numbers will be freezed until mouse hovering on them. But, if a user first clicks on scrollbar, drags it, then click on UP/DOWN, it works correctly. But clicking on UP/DOWN directly, doesn't update the contents of the dropdown box.

bug.title: "Fields" don't disappear when selecting other connections
bug.body: Steps to reproduce: 1. Select a connection. Object Explorer automatically should displays all tables. 2. Select a table. The "fields" panel below should be auto populated with attributes of the selected table. 3. Now select other connection or connection group. The table list disappears, which is correct, but the "fields" are still populated with the data of last selected table. It should also become empty like the table list.
